content:
Hello,
I was wondering if anyone of you have done polling set up on Zulip docker container?
I could only find information on how to set up polling on regular zulip server.
https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/email-gateway.html

Do I just add the following lines to docker-compose.yml?

EMAIL_GATEWAY_PATTERN = ""

EMAIL_GATEWAY_LOGIN = ""

The IMAP server & port to connect to

EMAIL_GATEWAY_IMAP_SERVER = ""
EMAIL_GATEWAY_IMAP_PORT = 993

The IMAP folder name to check for emails. All emails sent to EMAIL_GATEWAY_PATTERN above

must be delivered to this folder

EMAIL_GATEWAY_IMAP_FOLDER = "INBOX"

Thank you so much. :)
@jcheng you'll need the SETTINGS_ prefix in the settings names, but I'm aware of no reason that wouldn't work.

Tim Abbott said:

jcheng you'll need the SETTINGS_ prefix in the settings names, but I'm aware of no reason that wouldn't work.

Tim,
Thank you so much for taking the time to reply to my question. I really appreciate.
One more question do you know where I can put the password for the email account?
In zulip container, we don't use zulip-secrets.conf this file (or do we)?
If we don't use zulip-secrets.conf, do I also store the password in docker-compose.yml?
What is the password line that I need to use to store password?
For example, for redis I need to use the following line.
SECRETS_redis_password: "this is password"
Thank you so much again. :)
@jcheng this is covered in detail here: https://github.com/zulip/docker-zulip#configuration

Tim Abbott said:

jcheng this is covered in detail here: https://github.com/zulip/docker-zulip#configuration

Hi Tim,
Thank you so much for your help again. :)
